HTML: HyperText Markup Language, the standard markup language for creating web pages
CSS: Cascading Style Sheets, used for describing the presentation of a document written in HTML
!DOCTYPE: Declares the document type and HTML version
html: The root element of an HTML page
head: Contains metadata about the HTML document
title: Specifies a title for the HTML page
body: Defines the document's body, contains all visible contents
hr: Defines a thematic change in the content
div: Defines a section in a document
span: Defines a section in a document
form: Defines an HTML form for user input
option: Defines an option in a drop-down list
label: Defines a label for an input element
fieldset: Groups related elements in a form
legend: Defines a caption for a fieldset element
style: Defines style information for a document
link: Defines the relationship between a document and an external resource
meta: Defines metadata about an HTML document
header: Defines a header for a document or section
footer: Defines a footer for a document or section
main: Specifies the main content of a document
section: Defines a section in a document
aside: Defines content aside from the page content
details: Defines additional details that the user can view or hide
summary: Defines a visible heading for a details element
figcaption: Defines a caption for a figure element
source: Defines multiple media resources for media elements
canvas: Used to draw graphics, on the fly, via scripting
svg: Defines a container for SVG graphics
font-family: Specifies the font for an element
font-weight: Sets the weight (boldness) of the font
font-style: Specifies the font style (normal, italic, or oblique)
font-size: Sets the size of the font
line-height: Sets the height of a line of text
webfont: A font specifically designed for use on websites
@font-face: CSS at-rule to specify a custom font to display text on web pages
WOFF: Web Open Font Format, a font format for use in web pages
WOFF2: Web Open Font Format 2, an improved version of WOFF with better compression
TTF: TrueType Font, a font format that can be used on the web
OTF: OpenType Font, an extensible font format that can be used on the web
:hover: Pseudo-class that matches when the user interacts with an element with a pointing device
:active: Pseudo-class that matches when an element is being activated by the user
:focus: Pseudo-class that matches when an element has focus
:first-child: Pseudo-class that matches elements that are the first child of their parent
:nth-child(): Pseudo-class that matches elements based on their position among siblings
:not(): Pseudo-class that represents elements that do not match a list of selectors
picture: Contains multiple elements and one element to offer alternative versions of an image
progress: Represents the completion progress of a task
meter: Represents a scalar measurement within a known range
map: Defines an image map (an image with clickable areas)
contenteditable: Global attribute that specifies whether the content of an element is editable
spellcheck: Global attribute to enable/disable spell checking for an element
hidden: Global attribute that hides an element
data-*: Custom data attributes to store private custom data
viewport meta tag: Helps control layout on mobile browsers
srcset: Attribute for that specifies multiple image sources for different screen sizes
lazy loading: Technique to defer loading of non-critical resources at page load time
Flexbox: One-dimensional layout method for laying out items in rows or columns
Media Queries: CSS technique to apply styles based on device characteristics
accessibility: Practice of making websites usable by as many people as possible
ARIA: Accessible Rich Internet Applications, a set of attributes to improve accessibility
semantic HTML: Use of HTML markup to reinforce the meaning of content
